text: Yea I think the idea is, Julia is amazing for mathy stuff, Rust is pretty awesome for systemsy stuff. If you need mathy systemsy stuff, it makes sense to use both :slightly_smiling_face:. But I agree very different end use for the tools.

text: One of the things that I think would massively help both languages is if we could get more people bringing knowledge back and forth. I'm sure there are a ton of really cool techniques that could be broadly applicable, but are currently siloed knowledge to 1 comunity

attachments.title: Standardizing WASI: A system interface to run WebAssembly outside the web – Mozilla Hacks - the Web developer blog
attachments.text: WebAssembly is an assembly language for a conceptual machine, not a physical one. This is why it can be run across a variety of different machine architectures. WebAssembly needs a ...
